ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: We learned about the world of women's fashion and international sports and how consulting for organizations should work.
I learned how to conduct a semester-long research project from scratch -- collaborating with diverse stakeholders and working with a main client.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: met so many AMAZING people, Professor Davis is a gem, very unique and interesting topic

Weaknesses: I don't think we should have had a guest speaker each week and/or we should have had more time during class to work on the final project and our topic (fashion + sports) did not really match with our client (if we had had a different client, perhaps a fashion brand like Nike, the topic would have worked SO much better)

strengths: nice professor, collaborative environment
weaknesses: I feel like we got pulled away from the fact that this was a global affairs issue and I wish we had more speakers that could speak to international sports
The strengths were the speaker series that Professor Davis organized where we heard many different perspectives on the past, present, and future of women's sports, fashion, and their intersection.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! This course is really facilitated to build a network, which is something so special and you cannot find in any other course. I also think this is because of Professor Davis's amazing contacts.

I would recommend this course if you are looking for a Global Capstone that is a little bit unconventional in the sense that the topic might appear unrelated to "Global Affairs" but the ecosystem that surrounds it makes it wholly clear that sports, culture, and politics are intimately intertwined.
